summary: Zambia is a country in Africa, surrounded by seven countries. It gained independence from the UK in 1964 and became a republic led by President Kenneth Kaunda. Initially a one-party state, it transitioned to a multi-party democracy in 1991. Zambia is known for its natural resources and has a strong economy, with the capital, Lusaka, as its economic hub. The country has a history of colonial rule and has played a role in regional diplomacy, working towards resolving conflicts in neighboring nations. Today, Zambia enjoys peaceful power transitions and is a member of the Common Market for Eastern and Southern Africa (COMESA).
title: Zambia
